backText: Registration and attendance are 100% free, with meals, drinks, swag, & workshops included.
Any current high school student, grades 9 – 12, from Flagstaff or anywhere around the world.
If you’re in middle school and are interested in attending, please contact us & we’ll see what we can do.

frontText: What if I’m new to coding?
backText: Complete beginners are not only welcome, but expected!
Learn as you go with our intro workshops & mentors.

frontText: What if I already know how to code?
backText: If you are an expert, let us know if you'd like to also volunteer to host a workshop. You will still have chances to win cool prizes.
Nope! You’ll have an opportunity to meet fellow hackers and make teams of up to 4 people. Find some new friends, bring yours, or work alone.
Anything! A website, app, game, model, you name it. We will have different categories to submit for prizes. Judges will rate projects on creativity, technical skill demonstrated, polish, & utility.
Student ID, computer, chargers. We will have some materials to use for prototypes (like arts, crafts, and building supplies). We will also have loaner laptops for you to use if you don't have one.

frontText: Who runs this? Is it supervised?
backText: We’re independently-organized by high schoolers and sponsored via an international non-profit called Hack Club. The event is fully supervised by teachers and other adult volunteers.

frontText: I'm ready to signup! How do I register?
backText: Registration opens on September 1st. You will join a Discord channel to ask questions and get to know other hackathon attendees (virtually).
The Hackathon theme and challenge categories for prizes will be annouced at the event.
